articles.headline: Senate Republicans Say They Will Not Vote on Health Bill
articles.snippet: Senate Republicans said they would not move ahead with a vote on the latest plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act, which lacked the support to pass.
articles.abstract: Senate Republicans said they would not move ahead with a vote on the latest plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act, which lacked the support to pass.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans on Tuesday officially abandoned the latest plan to repeal the Affordable Care Act, shelving a showdown vote on the measure and effectively admitting defeat in their last-gasp drive to fulfill a core promise of President Trump and Republican lawmakers.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan and Robert Pear

articles.headline: Will a Corporate Tax Holiday Give Workers Anything to Cheer?
articles.snippet: Investment and jobs from the repatriation of profits held abroad have been promised in the past. But the incentives to executives will need to change.
articles.abstract: Investment and jobs from the repatriation of profits held abroad have been promised in the past. But the incentives to executives will need to change.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the summer of 2004, and to the glee of multinational corporations across the United States, a bipartisan majority in Congress offered them a gift they had long sought: an opportunity to repatriate billions of dollars stashed overseas and pay just 5.25 percent in taxes, instead of the statutory corporate rate of 35 percent.

articles.headline: Saudi Arabia Agrees to Let Women Drive
articles.snippet: The monarchy abandoned its driving ban for women, long criticized as an infringement on women’s rights and a drag on the economy and society.
articles.abstract: The monarchy abandoned its driving ban for women, long criticized as an infringement on women’s rights and a drag on the economy and society.
articles.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia announced on Tuesday that it would allow women to drive, ending a longstanding policy that has become a global symbol of the oppression of women in the ultraconservative kingdom.

articles.headline: As Google Fights Fake News, Voices on the Margins Raise Alarm
articles.snippet: The editorial head of a socialist website complained that Google is censoring the internet by curbing search traffic to his publication.
articles.abstract: The editorial head of a socialist website complained that Google is censoring the internet by curbing search traffic to his publication.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When David North, the editorial chairman of the World Socialist Web Site, noticed a drop in the site’s traffic in April, he initially chalked it up to news fatigue over President Trump or a shift in political consciousness.

articles.headline: Trump to Propose Sweeping Tax Cut for Corporations and Individuals
articles.snippet: The proposal is an attempt to answer wealthy donors’ demands for lower taxes without being seen by the president’s working-class base as a windfall for the rich.
articles.abstract: The proposal is an attempt to answer wealthy donors’ demands for lower taxes without being seen by the president’s working-class base as a windfall for the rich.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump will propose a sweeping rewrite of the federal tax code on Wednesday, outlining a plan to reduce rates for corporations and individuals and eliminate some popular deductions, in a move that will set off a scramble among powerful groups eager to protect their tax breaks.
articles.byline: By Glenn Thrush and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: ‘This Is Like in War’: A Scramble to Care for Puerto Rico’s Sick and Injured
articles.snippet: The situation on Puerto Rico was becoming increasingly critical as residents struggled to find medical care amid a shortage of power, water and gasoline.
articles.abstract: The situation on Puerto Rico was becoming increasingly critical as residents struggled to find medical care amid a shortage of power, water and gasoline.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — As Hurricane Maria pummeled Puerto Rico, María Martínez Espada, 86, slipped because of a water leak in her apartment and broke her hip. Almost a week later, doctors at Hospital del Maestro have not been able to operate because of a shortage of medical supplies.
articles.byline: By Luis Ferré-Sadurní, Frances Robles and Lizette Alvarez

articles.headline: Roy Moore Wins Senate G.O.P. Runoff in Alabama
articles.snippet: Mr. Moore, a firebrand former chief justice of the Alabama Supreme Court, overcame efforts by top Republicans to rescue his rival, Senator Luther Strange.
articles.abstract: Mr. Moore, a firebrand former chief justice of the Alabama Supreme Court, overcame efforts by top Republicans to rescue his rival, Senator Luther Strange.
articles.lead_paragraph: MONTGOMERY, Ala. — Roy S. Moore, a firebrand former chief justice of the Alabama Supreme Court, overcame efforts by top Republicans to rescue his rival, Senator Luther Strange, soundly defeating him on Tuesday in a special primary runoff.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Alexander Burns

articles.headline: Should the Middle Class Invest in Risky Tech Start-Ups?
articles.snippet: With the tech industry’s increasing dominance, Jason Calacanis, a tech investor, offers a radical guide for prospering: betting on more of it.
articles.abstract: With the tech industry’s increasing dominance, Jason Calacanis, a tech investor, offers a radical guide for prospering: betting on more of it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jason Calacanis cuts an unusual figure for a financial savior in Silicon Valley, where it’s fashionable for the world’s richest men to feign embarrassed modesty about their wealth and power.

articles.headline: Trump Proposes the Most Sweeping Tax Overhaul in Decades
articles.snippet: In Indiana, President Trump began an intense push to slash taxes and salvage what is left of his foundering legislative agenda in Congress.
articles.abstract: In Indiana, President Trump began an intense push to slash taxes and salvage what is left of his foundering legislative agenda in Congress.
articles.lead_paragraph: INDIANAPOLIS — President Trump on Wednesday began an ambitious push to slash taxes and salvage what remains of his embattled legislative agenda in Congress this year, proposing a politically challenging array of tax cuts for individuals and businesses that would constitute the most sweeping changes to the federal tax code in decades.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Google Offers Concessions to Europe After Record Antitrust Fine
articles.snippet: The search giant is changing how it operates its online shopping service, signaling a new willingness to bow to tightening regulatory pressure around the world.
articles.abstract: The search giant is changing how it operates its online shopping service, signaling a new willingness to bow to tightening regulatory pressure around the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: Google announced concessions on Wednesday to European regulators over its online shopping service, signaling a new willingness by the Silicon Valley company to bow to tightening pressures from governments around the world.
